title: Beacon node repeatedly processes the same blocks
body:
# üêû Bug Report ### Description logs repeatedly process the same blocks, never making any progress. Checked if this was a known issue or user error in discord and was directed to open a ticket. I saw this behavior when using --head-sync option. I may have nuked the database on a previous restart, so I am guessing it did not have up to date state to start from. ### Has this worked before in a previous version? Never tried in a previous version ## üî¨ Minimal Reproduction I was able to reproduce just by rebooting my machine and rerunning. But the state of the database may be the issue here, to get to this state I had rebooted without remembering to add --head-sync (my intent was to test the command). The beacon node started on reboot via a script. I then modified my boot script to add --head-sync hoping I might be able to try again and rebooted again. Before rebooting the first time the beacon node was synced. ## üî• Error error manifested in repeated logs processing the same block

$ cat /etc/os-release
NAME="Linux Mint"
VERSION="20 (Ulyana)"
ID=linuxmint
ID_LIKE=ubuntu
PRETTY_NAME="Linux Mint 20"
VERSION_ID="20"
HOME_URL="https://www.linuxmint.com/"

PRIVACY_POLICY_URL="https://www.linuxmint.com/"
VERSION_CODENAME=ulyana
UBUNTU_CODENAME=focal
**What version of Prysm are you running? (Which release)** 
  
$ ./prysm/prysm.sh version
Latest Prysm version is v1.0.0-beta.0.rc.
this has since been resolved in 1.0.0-beta.1, please let us know if the issue persists and we can reopen @rev3ks
